perturbation.original_text: Section 2. Retention of Agent;  Compensation;  Sale and Delivery of the Shares.  Subject to the terms and conditions  herein set forth,  the Company and the Bank have retained the Agent to consult with and to advise the Bank, the MHC and the Company,  and to assist the Company,  on a best  efforts  basis,  in the distribution  of the shares of Common Stock in the  Offering.  The services that the  Agent  will  provide  include,  but are not  limited  to (i)  training  the employees  of the Bank who will  perform  certain  ministerial  functions in the Subscription  and Community  Offering  regarding  the  mechanics and  regulatory requirements of the stock offering process,  (ii) managing the Stock Information Center by assisting  interested stock  subscribers and by keeping records of all stock orders and (iii) preparing marketing materials.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 2. Retention of Agent; Compensation; Sale and Delivery of the Shares. Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth, the Company and the Bank *may* retain the Agent to consult with and to advise the Bank, the MHC and the Company, and *may* assist the Company, on a best efforts basis, in the distribution of the shares of Common Stock in the Offering. The services that the Agent *may* provide include, but are not limited to (i) training the employees of the Bank who will perform certain ministerial functions in the Subscription and Community Offering regarding the mechanics and regulatory requirements of the stock offering process, (ii) managing the Stock Information Center by assisting interested stock subscribers and by keeping records of all stock orders and (iii) preparing marketing materials.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the Company and the Bank 'have retained' the Agent. The modified version uses 'may retain,' contradicting the initial assertion and creating uncertainty about the Agent's role and whether they are obligated to provide any services.

perturbation.original_text:
The Agent shall receive the following compensation for its services hereunder:

          (a)  A  management  fee of $25,000,  payable in four  installments  of                $6,250 on  November 29 and  December  29, 1999 and January 29 and                February 29,  2000.  Should the  Offering be  terminated  for any                reason not  attributable  to the action or inaction of the Agent,                the Agent  shall  have  earned  and be  entitled  to be paid fees                accruing through the stage at which the termination occurred.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Agent shall receive the following compensation for its services hereunder:

          (a)  A  management  fee *up to* $25,000,  *potentially* payable in four  installments  of                $6,250 on  November 29 and  December  29, 1999 and January 29 and                February 29,  2000.  Should the  Offering be  terminated  for any                reason not  attributable  to the action or inaction of the Agent,                the Agent *may* have  earned  and *may not* be  entitled  to be paid fees                accruing through the stage at which the termination occurred.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the Agent 'shall receive' a management fee of '$25,000'. The modified version uses 'up to $25,000' and 'potentially payable', contradicting the initial assertion and creating uncertainty about the Agent's fees.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 11.  Termination.  The Agent may  terminate  this  Agreement by giving  the  notice  indicated  below in this  Section 11 at any time after this Agreement becomes effective as follows:

          (a)  In the  event  the  Company  fails to sell the  required  minimum                number of the Shares by _________,  2000, and in accordance  with                the provisions of the Plan or as required by the MHC Regulations,                and applicable law, this Agreement shall terminate upon refund by                the Company to each person who has  subscribed for or ordered any                of the Shares the full amount which it may
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 11.  Termination.  The Agent *may* terminate  this  Agreement by giving  the  notice  indicated  below in this  Section 11 at any time after this Agreement becomes effective as follows:

          (a)  In the  event  the  Company  fails to sell the  required  minimum                number of the Shares by _________,  2000, and in accordance  with                the provisions of the Plan or as required by the MHC Regulations,                and applicable law, this Agreement *may* terminate upon refund by                the Company to each person who has  subscribed for or ordered any                of the Shares the full amount which it may
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the Agent 'may terminate this agreement'. However, Section 11(a) now is contradictory by stating 'this Agreement shall terminate upon refund'.
